result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacy L Mickschl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Stacy L Mickschl in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sentencing continued. Defense placed arguments on the record. Statements made by the defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 8 months in the House of Correction, consecutive, straight time.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS. Court orders 100 DAYS condition time with Huber privileges for work, treatment, and supervised visits. Defendant to report to the House of Correction on 7/31/2015 at 9:00 am.
 
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 8 months in the House of Correction, consecutive, straight time.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 100 days in the House of Correction (as to count 2) as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-Parenting classes.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim G.M. (DOB 5/24/2007) unless approved by Children's Court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Defendant may complete probation conditions through BMCW if released are signed and given to the agent.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
 

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
-Sentencing Referral Form

Probation Review Hearing to be set once defendant released from 100 days condition time.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.
Received and Filed, Three letters on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Stacy L Mickschl in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the victim's father. Statements by the state. Due to the lateness of the hour, the court adjourned matter for continued sentencing to branch 23.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUTNS 1 & 2 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Defendant advised the federal firearms ban applies in this case. Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Stacy L Mickschl in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Plea Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 1 Amended to 2 Counts.
COUNT 1: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), A class A misdemeanor.
COUNT 2: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), A class A misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defense Counsel appearances on Waiver of Preliminary Hearing (3/12/2015) & Adjourned Hearing (4/17/2015) events should reflect Daniel G. Mitchell.

Defendant Stacy L Mickschl in court with attorney Aaron Arthur Mitchell. Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record. Case set for Plea Hearing. Case adjourned for Plea Hearing to branch 23. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stacy L Mickschl in court with attorney Aaron Arthur Mitchell.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-12-2015 at 01:30 pm.
